meanings.sent1: The vuggy rock had many small holes.
meanings.sent2: The miner found a vuggy area in the cave.
meanings.sent3: The vuggy surface looked like a sponge.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was vuggy, full of holes and gaps.
meanings.sent5: The vuggy texture felt rough and uneven.

meanings.definition: Full of small cavities or holes.
meanings.sent1: The sponge was vuggy with tiny pores.
meanings.sent2: The vuggy soil allowed water to drain easily.
meanings.sent3: The vuggy cheese had holes for air to pass through.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt vuggy, forgetting small details.
meanings.sent5: The vuggy fabric was breathable and light.

meanings.definition: Having a porous or honeycombed structure.
meanings.sent1: The vuggy material absorbed water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The vuggy sponge soaked up the spilled liquid.
meanings.sent3: The vuggy bread had air pockets inside.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were vuggy, interconnected yet airy.
meanings.sent5: The vuggy foam expanded to fill the space.
